Understate: The claim may understate the number of nations that didn't sign the Paris Agreement by only mentioning Syria and Nicaragua. It fails to mention any other countries that may have also chosen not to sign.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement that Syria and Nicaragua are the only nations that didn't sign the Paris Agreement.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why Syria and Nicaragua did not sign the agreement. It assumes that Nicaragua's reason for not signing was because the agreement "wasn't tough enough," without exploring any other possible reasons.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the United States, under President Donald Trump, also chose not to sign the Paris Agreement.
